data.title: First picture of woman, 78, found dead inside Edinburgh home after man charged by cops
data.meta_description: A PENSIONER who was found dead inside an Edinburgh home has been pictured for the first time.Margaret Parker, 78, died following an alleged disturbanc
data.text:
A PENSIONER who was found dead inside an Edinburgh home has been pictured for the first time.

Margaret Parker, 78, died following an alleged disturbance inside a house in Fernieside Crescent in Edinburgh.

She was pronounced dead at the scene.

Cops have confirmed a 36-year-old man has been arrested and charged in connection with her death.

He has also been charged in relation to the attempted murder of a 55-year-old woman and a 42-year-old woman during the same alleged disturbance.

The man is due to appear at Edinburgh Sheriff Court tomorrow.

Police Scotland are still probing the alleged incident.

Detective Inspector Dougal Begg said: “Our thoughts are with the family and friends of Margaret Parker and everyone affected by this tragic incident.

"A continued police presence can be seen in the area as officers continue their enquiries into this isolated incident.”

We told how locals feared they'd heard gunfire as multiple loud bangs - believed to be a police tactical device - were captured on a Ring doorbell after armed cops swarmed the street at 8.25am.

Police confirmed that a woman was pronounced dead at the scene and a younger man had been arrested.

More than 20 emergency services vehicles swarmed the site, according to locals.

And one resident caught the terrifying moment on their Ring doorbell camera.

In the footage, an officer can be seen walking through a garden before five bangs were heard.

A few seconds later, a further six were recorded.

PIRC has confirmed that it is assessing a referral in relation to an incident involving the death of Ms Parker.

A PIRC spokesperson said: “The Police Investigations and Review Commissioner is currently assessing a referral from Police Scotland in relation to an incident involving the death of a 78-year-old woman in Edinburgh on 21 May 2024.”
